title: 'Require Approval' community: description of their rules/user experience
body:
This issue is non-actionnable and a description of how 'require approval' communities work and can be used. 

This will be closed when all main shareholders have acknowledge they are fine with this behaviour for phase 1 and 2. @guylouis to collect any feedbacks about this. 

Phase 3 will see a revamp of the mechanisms to be a member of a community (will introduce tokenization)

- **ADMIN**
  - can create communities and channels
- **MEMBERS**
  - can see communities they are a member of (in the list of communities)
  - can not see communities they are not a member of (in the list of communities)
  - can write in all channels of the community they are a member of
- **INVITATION TO A COMMUNITY**
    - Only the admin can invite someone to a community: 
            - this person needs to be part of his contacts (this is just a UI matter, not a protocol one)
            - this person is automatically added as a member of the community, without asking him if he wants it or not 
            - this person receives  chat message with a description of the community and a button to ~~open~~ join the community 
            - this person can then accept to join or not, if he joins he'll see the community, if not he won't see it in his UI
- **SHARING A COMMUNITY**
  - Anyone can share a community
  - Sharing feature is embedded in the UI for admins and for members
  - Sharing is similar to sharing the link to the description of the community, the description shows a a widget with the description of the community and number of members
    - For ‘require approval’ community, when someone sees the description of the community, and if he’s not a member, he’s prompted if he wants to require access
            - If he does ask for access
                - The admin and only the admin can approve/refuse the membership
                - If he does accept, the user becomes a member
                - If he does not, the user does not become a member
- **SHARING A COMMUNITY (with link)**
  - Each ‘require approval' community has a link (#12131)
  - This link can be sent through status chat and unfurls as the community description widget (#12132)
  - The behaviour is then the same as above
  - Also this link is a deeplink to Status, so if it’s opened though the system browser it opens status and opens a specific screen that shows the community widget (#12133)

closing this since there were no negative feedbacks
adding this issue as a reference here https://notes.status.im/communities-ressources?view
